climbs.name: Slab Route, Right aka Jim's Dihedral

content.description:
This is a fairly pleasant romp up to a cool (exposed) summit.  It starts out as a scramble then moves into the dihedral.

If you go by Slab Route, Right it is a 5.6.  If you call it Jim's Dihedral then it is a 5.7.

Short route but enjoyable and worth the hike up the gully.
content.protection: Rack up to a #3 Friend for the route.  I used bigger pieces for the anchor (#3 & #4 Camalots).
content.location:
From the south end scramble around to the northeast side.  It is the right facing dihedral to the right of

Slab Route

(see picture).  Rap off the north end via exposed scramble.

content.description:
This route shares the same start as

Slab Route, Right

.  At the small roof go left over a bulge (crux #1), follow the slab to an arete then surmount the arete to the top (crux #2).

Rob mantled crux #2.  Karen jammed the crack near the arete on crux #2.  Like skinning a cat, cruxes can be done more than one way.

This description has been brought to you by Karen and Rob.
content.protection: Light rack, micro-nut for the second crux (per Rob).
content.location: From the south end scramble around to the northeast side.  It is just left of Slab Route, Right (see picture).  Rap off the north end via exposed scramble.
